intro: Dendrolirium coriaceum, commonly known as the leatherleaf lily, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the orchid family (Orchidaceae) and is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces striking white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its unique foliage and elegant blooms make it a notable species in botanical gardens and natural habitats.
